content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: While discussing as the greedy landlord, Peter Schmidt: As a highly sought-after apartment in the city center, I must emphasize its superior location and excellent features. Considering the market demand, I believe a monthly rent of 1100 Euros would be fair. However, if you are keen on this apartment and can offer a higher price, I'd be more than happy to negotiate further.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Thank you for sharing the information about the apartment, Mr. Schmidt. However, I don't find the proposed 1100 Euros rental price acceptable due to my strict budget constraints. I'm an ambitious student who values responsible spending. I'm looking to rent an apartment like this one but at a significantly lower price to match my financial situation. I hope you can understand my perspective and consider adjusting the price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: As Peter Schmidt trying to maintain a high price: While I understand your financial circumstances as a student, this apartment's prime location and exceptional amenities set it apart from others in the market. As a result, I'm unable to lower the rent significantly below 1100 Euros per month. However, I am open to discussing other options if you're interested in a shorter lease term or less furnished apartment, which might result in a reduced rental fee.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I appreciate your consideration, Mr. Schmidt, but as a responsible individual, I'm more inclined to prioritize long-term stability over such concessions. My preference still remains in renting this particular apartment at a lower price rather than exploring alternative options. I'm hopeful that we can reach a mutually agreeable arrangement.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: As Peter Schmidt, reluctantly but trying to find common ground: Although my initial stance remains firm on the rental price, I am willing to consider a concession of 100 Euros if you are able to sign a longer lease term, possibly two years or more. This would provide me with the long-term stability I seek as a landlord. Let me know if this proposal is acceptable to you.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: While signing a longer lease term of two years or more is an option I'm open to considering, I'm still finding it difficult to accept a rental price of 1000 Euros per month, even with the concession. As a student, my financial situation is still quite limited, and I'm looking for a lower rent to match my budget. I'm sorry if this disappoints you but I have to maintain my stance on this matter.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: As Peter Schmidt, feeling frustrated but trying to find a solution: It's indeed a challenging situation, given my desire to maintain a competitive rental price due to the apartment's attractiveness. However, I might be able to offer a final concession of 200 Euros from the initial price if you are willing to take the apartment unfurnished. This would reduce the monthly rent to 900 Euros while also lowering my own costs. I hope this compromise is more in line with your budgetary constraints.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mr. Schmidt, I sincerely appreciate your continued efforts to work towards a mutually agreeable solution. An unfurnished apartment is acceptable to me, and the reduced rental price of 900 Euros per month is within my financial limits. I'm pleased to accept this proposal. I agree to the price of 900 Euros! TERMINATE
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China
